description: From Middle English square, sqware, squyre; from Old French esquarre, esquerre, (modern French équerre), from Vulgar Latin *exquadra, from Latin ex- +‎ quadro, from quadrus.

entries.meaning: Shaped like a square (the polygon).
examples: Hypernyms: rectangular, polygonal
Coordinate terms: circular, oval, triangular, trapezoidal, rectangular, rhomboid

entries.meaning: (of box-shaped objects such as buildings or metal frames) Forming right angles in all planes as intended; not racked or leaning.
examples: The foundation has to be level and the framing has to be square.
Antonyms: out of square, crooked, racked

entries.meaning: (nautical) Forming right angles with the mast or the keel, and parallel to the horizon; said of the yards of a square-rigged vessel when they are so braced.
Used in the names of units of area formed by multiplying a unit of length by itself.
examples: square metre
square mile
Coordinate terms: cubic, linear

entries.meaning: Honest; straightforward; fair.
examples: I'm just looking for a square deal on my car repair.
square dealing
Synonyms: above board, on the level, on the square, on the up and up, straight

entries.meaning: Satisfied; comfortable with; not experiencing any conflict.
Even; tied
examples: to make or leave the accounts square

entries.meaning: (slang, derogatory) Socially conventional; boring.
examples: Synonym: bourgeois

entries.meaning: (cricket) In line with the batsman's popping crease.
Solid, decent, substantial.
examples: It may be prison, but at least I'm getting three square meals a day.

entries.meaning: Having a shape broad for the height, with angular rather than curving outlines.
examples: a man of a square frame

adverbs.description: square (comparative more square, superlative most square)

entries.meaning: Directly.
(geometry) A polygon with four sides of equal length and four right angles; an equilateral rectangle; a regular quadrilateral.
examples: Hypernyms: shape, polygon, rectangle
Coordinate terms: circle, oval, triangle, trapezoid, rectangle, rhombus, lozenge, diamond

definitionGroups.group: Something characterized by a square, or nearly square, form.

entries.meaning: A cell in a grid.
examples: You may not move a piece to a square already occupied by one of your own pieces.

entries.meaning: A square piece, part, or surface.
examples: a square of glass

entries.meaning: The front of a woman's dress over the bosom, usually worked or embroidered.
(Canada, US) A dessert cut into rectangular pieces, or a piece of such a dessert.
(printing) A certain number of lines, forming a portion of a column, nearly square; used chiefly in reckoning the prices of advertisements in newspapers.
examples: Coordinate term: column inch

definitionGroups.group: An L- or T-shaped tool used to place objects or draw lines at right angles.

entries.meaning: (figuratively, obsolete) A true measure, standard, or pattern.

definitionGroups.group: An open space or park, often in the center of a town, not necessarily square in shape, often containing trees, seating and other features pleasing to the eye.

entries.meaning: (often in street names or addresses) A street surrounding a public square or plaza.
examples: Synonym: place

entries.meaning: (mathematics) The product of a number or quantity multiplied by itself; the second power of a number, value, term or expression.
examples: 64 is the square of 8.

entries.meaning: (military formation) A body of troops drawn up in a square formation.
examples: The French cavalry, in proof armour, repeatedly charged our squares, their cannon opening chasms; but the British infantry, though greatly diminished, were inflexible and impenetrable to the last.

entries.meaning: (1950s slang) A socially conventional or conservative person; a person who has little or no interest in the latest fads or trends: still sometimes used in modern terminology.
examples: Synonyms: see Thesaurus:mainstreamer
Antonyms: see Thesaurus:fashionable
Why do you always wear a tie? Don't be such a square!

entries.meaning: (Britain) The symbol # on a telephone; hash.
examples: Enter your account number followed by a square.
Synonyms: hash, sharp, (US) pound sign

entries.meaning: (cricket) The central area of a cricket field, with one or more pitches of which only one is used at a time.
examples: An ideal playing area is roughly circular in shape with a central area, the cricket square, measuring 27.44 metres by 27.44 metres and boundaries 45.75 metres from the sides of the square.

entries.meaning: (real estate) A unit of measurement of area, equal to a 10 foot by 10 foot square, i.e. 100 square feet or roughly 9.3 square metres. Used in real estate for the size of a house or its rooms, though progressively being replaced by square metres in metric countries such as Australia.
examples: Just as the basic unit of real estate measurement across the world is the square

entries.meaning: (roofing) A unit used in measuring roof area equivalent to 100 square feet (9.29 m²) of roof area. The materials for roofing jobs are often billed by the square in the United States.
(academia) A mortarboard.
(colloquial, US) Ellipsis of square meal.
examples: Even when times were tough, we got three squares a day.

entries.meaning: (archaic) Exact proportion; justness of workmanship and conduct; regularity; rule.
examples: They of Galatia [were] much more out of square.

entries.meaning: The relation of harmony, or exact agreement; equality; level.
(astrology) The position of planets distant ninety degrees from each other; a quadrate.
(dated) The act of squaring, or quarrelling; a quarrel.
(slang) Cigarette.
(brewing) A vat used for fermentation.
(slang, MLE) A well-defined core of a human body, a flat section from the fundament to the thoracic diaphragm.

verbs.description: square (third-person singular simple present squares, present participle squaring, simple past and past participle squared)

definitionGroups.group: (transitive) To adjust so as to align with or place at a right angle to something else; in particular:

entries.meaning: (nautical) To place at a right angle to the mast or keel.
examples: to square the yards

entries.meaning: (rowing) To rotate the oars so that they are perpendicular to the water.
(transitive, intransitive) To resolve or reconcile; to suit or fit.
examples: John can square this question up for us.
These results just don't square with what we expected.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To adjust or adapt so as to bring into harmony with something.
examples: I cannot square the results of the experiment with my hypothesis.
to square our actions by the opinions of others

entries.meaning: (transitive, mathematics) Of a value, term, or expression, to multiply by itself; to raise to the second power.
(transitive, geometry) To draw, with a pair of compasses and a straightedge only, a square with the same area as.
examples: square the circle

entries.meaning: (transitive, geometry) To tile (completely fill) with squares.
(soccer) To make a short low pass sideways across the pitch
(archaic) To take opposing sides; to quarrel.
To accord or agree exactly; to be consistent with; to suit; to fit.
examples: No works shall find acceptance  […]  that square not truly with the Scripture plan.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To go to opposite sides; to take an attitude of offense or defense, or of defiance; to quarrel.
To take a boxing attitude; often with up or off.
To form with four sides and four right angles.
To form with right angles and straight lines, or flat surfaces.
examples: to square mason's work

entries.meaning: To compare with, or reduce to, any given measure or standard.
(astrology) To hold a quartile position respecting.
examples: the icy Goat, the Crab that square the Scales
